required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Compare Oral PF-06651600, PF-06700841 and Placebo in Subjects With Moderate to Severe Ulcerative Colitis
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2b, Double-blind, Randomized, Placebo-controlled, Parallel Group, Dose Ranging Study Of Oral Pf-06651600 And Pf-06700841 As Induction And Chronic Therapy In Subjects With Moderate To Severe Ulcerative Colitis

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether PF-06651600 and PF-06700841 are effective in treatment of moderate to severe ulcerative colitis.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Total Mayo Score

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects achieving remission based on total Mayo score
secondary_outcome.description: Remission excludes friability and is based on total Mayo score of less than/equal to 2 with no individual subscore greater than 1 at Week 8.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects in remission based on total Mayo score
secondary_outcome.description: Remission excludes friability and is based on total Mayo score of less than/equal to 2 with no individual subscore greater than 1 at week 32.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects achieving improvement in endoscopic appearance
secondary_outcome.description: Improvement of endoscopic appearance is defined as a Mayo endoscopic subscore of less than/equal to 1

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects achieving clinical response
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical response is defined as a decrease from baseline in total Mayo score of at least 3 points and at least 30%, with an accompanying decrease in the subscore for rectal bleeding of at least 1 point or absolute subscore for rectal bleeding of 0 or 1.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects in endoscopic remission
secondary_outcome.description: Endoscopic remission is defined as an endoscopic subscore of 0.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects in symptomatic remission
secondary_outcome.description: Symptomatic remission is defined as a total Mayo score of 2 points or lower, with no individual subscore exceeding 1 point, and both rectal bleeding and stool frequency subscores of 0.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects achieving deep remission
secondary_outcome.description: Deep remission is defined as a total Mayo score of 2 points or lower, with no individual subscore exceeding 1 point and a 0 on both endoscopic and rectal bleeding subscores.

secondary_outcome.measure: Partial Mayo Scores and changes from baseline
Change from baseline in total Mayo score
Change from baseline in total Mayo score
Scores and changes from baseline in Inflammatory Bowel Disease Questionnaire (IBDQ) total score and domains
secondary_outcome.description: IBDQ domains include Bowel Symptoms, Systemic Symptoms, Emotional Function and Social Function.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects with IBDQ total score greater than/equal to 170.
Proportion of subjects with greater than/equal to 16 point increase in IBDQ total score from baseline
Proportion of subjects with improvement in IBDQ bowel symptom domain
secondary_outcome.description: Improvement is defined as an increase of at least 1.2 points from baseline in average score among IBDQ bowel symptom domain (items 1, 5, 9, 13, 17, 20, 22, 24, 26, 29).

secondary_outcome.measure: Scores and changes from baseline in SF-36 v2
secondary_outcome.description: SF-36 physical and mental component summary scores: PCS and MCS, and 8 domain scores.

secondary_outcome.measure: Scores and changes from baseline in EuroQoL-5 Dimensions
Incidence of serious infections
secondary_outcome.description: Serious infections are treated infections that require parenteral antimicrobial therapy and present with positive pre-treatment culture AND EITHER require hospitalization for treatment OR meet other criteria that require the infection to be classified as an SAE.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects achieving improvement in endoscopic appearance
secondary_outcome.description: Improvement of endoscopic appearance is defined as a Mayo endoscopic subscore of less than/equal to 1

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects achieving clinical response
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical response is defined as a decrease from baseline in total Mayo score of at least 3 points and at least 30%, with an accompanying decrease in the subscore for rectal bleeding of at least 1 point or absolute subscore for rectal bleeding of 0 or 1.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects in endoscopic remission
secondary_outcome.description: Endoscopic remission is defined as an endoscopic subscore of 0.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects in symptomatic remission
secondary_outcome.description: Symptomatic remission is defined as a total Mayo score of 2 points or lower, with no individual subscore exceeding 1 point, and both rectal bleeding and stool frequency subscores of 0.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects achieving deep remission
secondary_outcome.description: Deep remission is defined as a total Mayo score of 2 points or lower, with no individual subscore exceeding 1 point and a 0 on both endoscopic and rectal bleeding subscores.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of ulcerative colitis for greater than/equal to 4 months.
- Moderate to severe active ulcerative colitis
- Inadequate response to, loss of response to, or intolerance to at least one conventional therapy for UC.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant or breastfeeding
- Clinical findings suggestive of Crohn's Disease
- History of bowel surgery within 6 months
